snippet: Kathryn Ruemmler, the longest-serving White House counsel of President Obama’s administration, will step down in May, according to officials.
abstract: Kathryn Ruemmler, longest-serving White House counsel of Pres Obama's administration, is stepping down; Ruemmler wielded powerful influence, with president citing her as one of his most trusted advisers in recent years; finalist has been identified as her successor, but will not be announced until a background check is complete.
lead_paragraph: Kathryn Ruemmler, the longest-serving White House counsel of President Obama’s administration, will step down in May, according to officials.

headline.main: Departing White House Counsel Held Powerful Sway
headline.print_headline: Departing White House Counsel Held Powerful Sway
